description.narrative: Recently Prakarsa published its Illicit Financial Flows (IFF) report which attracted great attention from the media and the government demonstrated by the number of invitations received by Prakarsa to speak in front of important policy makers. However, as the report was published at the end of the first period of President Jokowi, Prakarsa thinks its necessary to continue its IFF advocacy work. Specifically to obtain the attention and acknowledgement of the new cabinet of the government on the magnitude of IFF cases in Indonesia. In October 2019, Jokowi who has been re-elected for his second period of presidency was inaugurated. Thus, early 2020 is aneffective and strategic time to start campaign and advocacy work on the IFF issue. Advancing the Indonesia Tax Justice Forum coalition: it is expected this project will improve the capacity of the forum and lead to stronger pressure to enhance the tax system in order to eliminate IFF. The Forum has developed its annual program for 2020 and the project is important to strengthen the ties of the forum that consist of a number of reputable CSOs in Indonesia including Prakarsa, Publish What You Pay Indonesia (PWYP), Lokataru,Institute for Essential Services Reform (IESR), Indonesian Consumers Foundation (YLKI), People's Coalition for the right to Water (KRUHA), Indonesia Global Justice (IGJ), Indonesia Corruption Watch (ICW), and Indonesian Forum for Budget Transparency (FITRA), and International NGO Forum on Indonesian Development INFID. Policy Advocacy: the project targets through its political lobby and dialogue with the authorities, not only the new cabinet of the government including the ministry of Finance, Ministry of Trade and Ministry of Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, but also the MPs. With active participation of the Forum, joint campaign and lobby will be conducted intensively within 3 months of time.

participating-org.narrative: Prakarsa Perkumpulan (The Center for Welfare Studies) is a Jakarta-based association, founded in 2004 by a number of civil society activists, who seeks to promote a democratic, just, and prosperous Indonesian society. Perkumpulan Prakarsa works to nurture and enhance welfare ideas and initiatives through independent research, capacity building and active participation for the stakeholders inorder to create social justice and prosperous society. Prakarsa works on a wide range of topics related to welfare issues, with national and local governments, parliaments, CSOs, universities, international organizations, private sector and mass media to bring ideas into initiatives and actions. The 4 focus areas of Prakarsa are welfare policies, fiscal policies, sustainable development; and quantitative and qualitative surveys. Since 2014 Prakarsa leads the Fair Finance Guide Coalition in Indonesia, composed of 7 Indonesia Civil Society organizations. Prakarsa hosted the Annual FFGI meeting in 2016.
